I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Hypotheses:
n: nat
a: nat

Goal:
~ list_has_dup (list_an a n)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
list_has_dup : forall X : Type, list X -> Prop
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
list_an_length : forall a n : nat, length (list_an a n) = n
list_an_spec : forall a n m : nat, In m (list_an a n) < -> a <= m < a + n
map_S_list_an : forall a n : nat, map S (list_an a n) = list_an (S a) n
list_an_S : forall a n : nat, list_an a (S n) = a :: list_an (S a) n
Nat.clearbit_eqb : forall a n m : nat, Nat.testbit (Nat.clearbit a n) m = (Nat.testbit a m && negb (n =? m))%bool
Nat.clearbit_iff : forall a n m : nat, Nat.testbit (Nat.clearbit a n) m = true < -> Nat.testbit a m = true /\ n <> m
Nat.clearbit = fun a n : nat => Nat.ldiff a (Nat.shiftl 1 n) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.clearbit (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.pow_nonzero : forall a b : nat, a <> 0 -> a ^ b <> 0
Nat.pow_eq_0_iff : forall a b : nat, a ^ b = 0 < -> b <> 0 /\ a = 0
list_an_plus : forall a n m : nat, list_an a (n + m) = list_an a n ++ list_an (n + a) m
in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a l \/ In a m -> In a (l ++ m)
in_app_or : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a (l ++ m) -> In a l \/ In a m
between_not_exists : forall (P Q : nat -> Prop) (k l : nat), between P k l -> (forall n : nat, in_int k l n -> P n -> ~ Q n) -> ~ exists_between Q k l
Forall_forall_map : forall (X : Type) (f : nat -> X) (n : nat) (l : list X) (P : X -> Prop), l = map f (list_an 0 n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> P (f i)) < -> Forall P l
list_has_dup_app_right : forall (X : Type) (l m : list X), list_has_dup l -> list_has_dup (l ++ m)
list_has_dup_app_left : forall (X : Type) (l m : list X), list_has_dup m -> list_has_dup (l ++ m)
list_has_dup_app_inv : forall (X : Type) (l m : list X), list_has_dup (l ++ m) -> list_has_dup l \/ list_has_dup m \/ (exists x : X, In x l /\ In x m)
perm_list_has_dup : forall (X : Type) (l m : list X), l ~p m -> list_has_dup l -> list_has_dup m
in_list_hd1 : forall (X : Type) (l : list X) (x : X), list_has_dup l -> list_has_dup (x :: l)
list_fun_inv : forall (X : Type) (l : list X), X -> {f : nat -> X | l = map f (list_an 0 (length l))}
list_has_dup_cons_inv : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (l : list X), list_has_dup (x :: l) -> In x l \/ list_has_dup l
list_hd_cons_inv : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (l : list X), list_has_dup (x :: l) -> In x l \/ list_has_dup l
list_an_duplicate_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l : list nat) (x : nat) (m : list nat) (y : nat) (r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ x :: m ++ y :: r -> a <= x /\ x < y < a + n
Nat.lt_dne : forall n m : nat, ~ ~ n < m < -> n < m
Znat.Nat2Z.inj_succ : forall n : nat, BinInt.Z.of_nat (S n) = BinInt.Z.succ (BinInt.Z.of_nat n)
list_an_app_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ r -> l = list_an a (length l) /\ r = list_an (a + length l) (length r)
Nat.neq_0 : ~ (forall n : nat, n = 0)
Nat.lt_irrefl : forall x : nat, ~ x < x
Nat.nlt_0_r : forall n : nat, ~ n < 0
gt_irrefl : forall n : nat, ~ n > n
partition_intersection : forall (X : Type) (l m k : list X), length k < length (l ++ m) -> incl (l ++ m) k -> list_has_dup l \/ list_has_dup m \/ (exists x : X, In x l /\ In x m)
Nat.nle_succ_diag_l : forall n : nat, ~ S n <= n
Nat.nle_succ_0 : forall n : nat, ~ S n <= 0
Nat.nlt_succ_diag_l : forall n : nat, ~ S n < n
Znat.Nat2Z.is_nonneg : forall n : nat, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.of_nat n)
Nat.pred_succ : forall n : nat, Nat.pred (S n) = n
n_SSn : forall n : nat, n <> S (S n)
in_list_hd0 : forall (X : Type) (l : list X) (x : X), In x l -> list_has_dup (x :: l)
succ_plus_discr : forall n m : nat, n <> S (m + n)
Nat.le_ngt : forall n m : nat, n <= m < -> ~ m < n
